00.text: In lifes wilderness, God is your compass. His wisdom guides your steps, and His peace fills your heart. Trust His leading, and He will illuminate your path with hope and resilience.

01.text: O Lord, in your strength the king rejoices, and in your salvation how greatly he exults!

02.text: And I saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

03.text: And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, Behold, the dwelling place of God is with man. He will dwell with them, and they will be his people, and God himself will be with them as their God.

04.text: For they all contributed out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty put in all she had to live on.

05.text: Say to the daughter of Zion, Behold, your king is coming to you, humble, and mounted on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a beast of burden.

06.text: For you make him most blessed forever you make him glad with the joy of your presence.

07.text: The one who conquers will have this heritage, and I will be his God and he will be my son.

08.text: And to this people you shall say: Thus says the Lord: Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.

09.text: And the crowds that went before him and that followed him were shouting, Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!

10.text: And when he entered Jerusalem, the whole city was stirred up, saying, Who is this?

11.text: Though they plan evil against you, though they devise mischief, they will not succeed.

12.text: Cry out and wail, son of man, for it is against my people. It is against all the princes of Israel. They are delivered over to the sword with my people. Strike therefore upon your thigh.

13.text: Be exalted, O Lord, in your strength! We will sing and praise your power.

14.text: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

15.text: When justice is done, it is a joy to the righteous but terror to evildoers.

16.text: He said to him a second time, Simon, son of John, do you love me? He said to him, Yes, Lord you know that I love you. He said to him, Tend my sheep.

17.text: He said to him the third time, Simon, son of John, do you love me? Peter was grieved because he said to him the third time, Do you love me? and he said to him, Lord, you know everything you know that I love you. Jesus said to him, Feed my sheep.

18.text: But not a hair of your head will perish.

19.text: By your endurance you will gain your lives.

20.text: Precious treasure and oil are in a wise man''s dwelling, but a foolish man devours it.

21.text: And Jesus answered them, Truly, I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what has been done to the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, Be taken up and thrown into the sea, it will happen.

22.text: And whatever you ask in prayer, you will receive, if you have faith.

23.text: And the city has no need of sun or moon to shine on it, for the glory of God gives it light, and its lamp is the Lamb.

24.text: And Israel defeated him with the edge of the sword and took possession of his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as to the Ammonites, for the border of the Ammonites was strong.

25.text: Now there are also many other things that Jesus did. Were every one of them to be written, I suppose that the world itself could not contain the books that would be written.

26.text: All day long he craves and craves, but the righteous gives and does not hold back.

27.text: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

28.text: Now when these things begin to take place, straighten up and raise your heads, because your redemption is drawing near.

29.text: A wicked man puts on a bold face, but the upright gives thought to his ways.

30.text: No wisdom, no understanding, no counsel can avail against the Lord.

31.text: The horse is made ready for the day of battle, but the victory belongs to the Lord.

32.text: If the ox gores a slave, male or female, the owner shall give to their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.

33.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

34.text: And to the rest of the Levites, the Merarite clans, were given out of the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with its pasturelands, Kartah with its pasturelands...

35.text: And the tenants took his servants and beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

36.text: But stay awake at all times, praying that you may have strength to escape all these things that are going to take place, and to stand before the Son of Man.

37.text: Finally he sent his son to them, saying, They will respect my son.

38.text: And early in the morning all the people came to him in the temple to hear him.

39.text: And they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.

40.text: As for the cities of the several Merarite clans, that is, the remainder of the clans of the Levites, those allotted to them were in all twelve cities.

41.text: The cities of the Levites in the midst of the possession of the people of Israel were in all fortyeight cities with their pasturelands.

42.text: Jesus said to them, Have you never read in the Scriptures: The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone this was the Lord''s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes?

43.text: Thus the Lord gave to Israel all the land that he swore to give to their fathers. And they took possession of it, and they settled there.

44.text: And the one who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces and when it falls on anyone, it will crush him.

45.text: Not one word of all the good promises that the Lord had made to the house of Israel had failed all came to pass.

46.text: When life's path seems uncertain, rest in the assurance that God is your guide. His love is a firm foundation, and His presence brings peace to your soul. Walk with Him, and He will turn every trial into a triumph.

47.text: When the journey feels long, remember that God is your strength. His love carries you, and His joy renews your spirit. Rest in Him, and He will transform weariness into newfound energy and purpose.

48.text: When challenges rise, God is your rock. His love fortifies your heart, and His grace ignites your spirit. Rely on Him, and watch as He strengthens you to soar above every obstacle.

49.text: In the moments of sorrow, remember that God is your comforter. His peace wraps around you like a tender blanket, and His hope lights the dark corners of your heart. Trust in Him, and watch sorrow transform into joy.

50.text: In the storm's chaos, God is your shelter. His love calms the winds, and His strength anchors your soul. Lean on Him, and He will quiet the tempest with His unwavering peace.

51.text: When your spirit feels burdened, remember that God is your renewal. His love refreshes like morning dew, and His promise breathes life into weary hearts. Trust in Him, and He will awaken new hope within you.

52.text: When you face the unknown, God is your guide. His wisdom lights the path ahead, and His presence walks beside you. Trust in Him, and He will lead you with steady hands and a faithful heart.

53.text: In moments of weakness, God is your strength. His power lifts your spirit, and His light casts out shadows. Cling to Him, and He will renew your courage each day.

54.text: When life feels overwhelming, God is your peace. His love cradles your heart, and His grace steadies your steps. Trust in Him, and He will fill each day with His comforting presence.

55.text: In the silence of uncertainty, God is your voice. His truth whispers through the silence, and His promises echo with hope. Listen to Him, and He will fill your heart with the assurance of His everlasting love.

56.text: In times of sorrow, God is your comfort. His arms wrap around you with compassion, and His peace surpasses all understanding. Rest in Him, and He will mend your broken heart with His unfailing love.

57.text: When you feel alone, God is your companion. His hand is always reaching out to you, and His presence fills the quiet moments. Rely on Him, and He will surround you with His eternal love.

58.text: In the midst of trials, God is your refuge. His shelter provides safety, and His promises are your fortress. Lean on Him, and He will guide you through every storm with His steadfast love.

59.text: In moments of doubt, God is your strength. His wisdom lights your path, and His power uplifts your spirit. Depend on Him, and He will renew your courage with His unwavering love.
